comments.body: I would probably keep it simpler and build two separate strings altogether
Sorry about this but, do you need `noResourcesFoundFormat`, you could call `Fprintln` directly
Do we want the client-go scheme or the kubectl scheme (pkg/kubectl/scheme)?
for this case, it doesn't really matter, since we're only decoding and don't care about priority order
do we need to initialize items to `Items: []runtime.RawExtension{}` to avoid null items if they do `-o json`?

Non initialized array will be an empty array and that's sufficient for our needs. I've added `TestEmptyResultJSON` as a security net for that case. We only print `No resources found` when using the default printers, b/c we don't have other way of saying there's nothing there. In case of JSON or other structured output you'll get an empty list.
reminds me for v1 we'll need two versions of this, beta1 and v1
this one in particular just checks group/kind, so it's version neutral... places where we check for *metav1beta1.Table will definitely need to add a switch
Maybe this should be `--watch-events` or `--include-events` (although I could maybe see that being confused with Events).  We're not super strict about prefixing flags though.
I like `--output-...` as a prefix, and since it's only allowed with `--watch` (or `--watch-only`), I thought qualifying it would be clearer
`--include-events` sounds like what describe does, separately fetching/printing related events

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +174,178 @@	cmd.Flags().BoolVarP(&o.Watch, "watch", "w", o.Watch, "After listing/getting the requested object, watch for changes. Uninitialized objects are excluded if no object name is provided.")
	cmd.Flags().BoolVar(&o.WatchOnly, "watch-only", o.WatchOnly, "Watch for changes to the requested object(s), without listing/getting first.")
	cmd.Flags().BoolVar(&o.OutputWatchEvents, "output-watch-events", o.OutputWatchEvents, "Output watch event objects when --watch or --watch-only is used. Existing objects are output as initial ADDED events.")
	cmd.Flags().Int64Var(&o.ChunkSize, "chunk-size", o.ChunkSize, "Return large lists in chunks rather than all at once. Pass 0 to disable. This flag is beta and may change in the future.")
	cmd.Flags().BoolVar(&o.IgnoreNotFound, "ignore-not-found", o.IgnoreNotFound, "If the requested object does not exist the command will return exit code 0.")

comments.body: When we implement sorting by column name we should be able to get rid of that, which should improve the amount data we send over the wire.

I was hoping to do this condition [here](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/90f681be107cf67aa610b836a6a45f99e0bf04f2/pkg/kubectl/cmd/get/get.go#L208-L213) so that we have all of them in a single place. We'll be fixing this in 1.12, properly.
Can you actually make this `func (o *GetOptions) AddFlags(flagset)` and put both bind bits in here?
